thread.title: Broncos v Bulldogs: Corey Oates starts as Wayne Bennett tweaks Brisbane line-up |
thread.title_full: Broncos v Bulldogs: Corey Oates starts as Wayne Bennett tweaks Brisbane line-up | The Advertiser

author: Peter Badel
title: Broncos v Bulldogs: Corey Oates starts as Wayne Bennett tweaks Brisbane line-up |
text:
TOWERING rookie Corey Oates has been catapulted into Brisbane’s starting side as the Broncos brace for a bruising showdown with a monster Bulldogs side tomorrow night at Suncorp Stadium.
Lachlan Maranta was originally named on one wing, but he will return to the bench to make way for Oates, whose 105kg frame will effectively give Brisbane another forward on kick returns.
Brisbane are already lacking size following the loss of starting front-rowers Adam Blair (suspension) and Josh McGuire (injury), bringing the hard-running Oates into the equation.
Classy centre Dale Copley was named on a five-man bench, but Broncos coach Wayne Bennett confirmed he would be culled to accommodate the swap between Oates and Maranta.
Oates trained strongly this morning at Brisbane’s final training run and will be given the green light by Bennett if he is fully fit on game day.
“Corey may start but we have to think how he pulls up. It’s not straightforward with Corey,” Bennett said.
BRISBANE BOOST: Kahu turns down big bucks for Broncos
NRL SUPERCOACH ANALYSIS: Cartwright buy of the week
“Right now he is playing some wing. He has just got to do better with repeat efforts, you can’t play NRL and not do multiple repeat efforts, it’s a case of him maturing a bit more and he will get there.
“We don’t have Frank Molo, we’ve lost Josh and Adam so we have (three) major hit-up forwards missing.
“That’s the Dogs’ strength. I’m confident enough we can match them, we’ll have to do that and we’ll have to be on our game.
“They are a quality football team and they wouldn’t be happy where they are, they are better team than that.
“They will be keen tomorrow night and we’ll have our hands full.”
Corey Oates at Brisbane Broncos training. Pic Darren England. Source: News Corp Australia
In another boost for the Broncos, back-rower Alex Glenn has overcome a virus and will start, while key halfback Ben Hunt has been passed fit after battling a minor calf strain.
Bennett said the Broncos were primed to hit back after last week’s shock 44-14 thumping against the Sea Eagles.
“We’re disappointed so it’s a chance to show everybody we can play and what we did last week,” he said.
“The players weren’t shocked, they saw it coming themselves individually, I thought the week before it would hit us but I was a week late in my judgment.
“We had a bad day and we have to accept that. We had to address things.
“We’re probably not playing with the consistency we were a month ago. Our performance last week was coming, it was just a matter of when it came, I hope it’s a timely reminder for them all to pick their act up.”
Originally published as Oates starts as Bennett tweaks Broncos line-up
